result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Brunner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with J. Brunner unless authorized by supervising agent.

Defendant to complete an Anger Managment Program, Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program or the equivalent together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M Brunner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:54 p.m. Defendant Chad M Brunner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by the DE. Court orders: 120 days WC Jail as to count 1 - 90 days WC Jail as to Ct 2 concurrent - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 2 year probation concurrent to any existing sentence - Conditions: Anger Managment Program, DAAP or the equivalent and follow through, NC w/ J. Brunner unless authorized by supervising agent, Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Requests add'l STC - Def facing Revocation in Winnebago Co - 3/15 hearing.  P/S Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:02 p.m. Defendant Chad M Brunner in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. DE will be privately retaining counsel if not eligible for SPD services. DA Blader requesting Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting a signature bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:45 am.
